intro: Malvastrum alberti, commonly known as the Albert's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Malvastrum alberti is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
